result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling Order

3:02 PM Defendant Mark Anthony Binder appeared by video.  Attorney Eric Caudill appeared by video for Mark Anthony Binder.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Caudill requests matter be set for trial.  
BY THE COURT:  Set for Scheduling Conference
Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Scheduling conference on August 25, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Approved s/CAH
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Approved/call to reset
to Reset

State files Information.  Atty Caudill received the Information and waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

11:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Binder in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill in court for Mark Anthony Binder. 
Bradley Wendt called and sworn.  Examined by Atty Juech.  RECORD TO REFLECT:  Witness had identified the defendant.  Cross-examined by Atty Caudill.  Re-direct by Atty Juech.  
State rests.  Defense has no witnesses.
Atty Juech moves for bind over.  Atty Caudill makes argument.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on July 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Binder appeared by video.  Attorney Eric Caudill appeared by video for Mark Anthony Binder. 
Atty Caudill asks that a Prelim be set on the matter.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim
bond continued
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:25 AM Defendant Mark Anthony Binder appeared by video.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Glenn Edward Avena appeared by video for Mark Anthony Binder. 
Atty Avena states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court confirms address and phone. Atty Avena waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 

Atty Avena makes additional arguments on the bond modification.  
Atty Juech objects.
BY THE COURT:  Bond modification is denied at this time.
Status hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

*No contact with Victim 1

03:22 PM Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark Anthony Binder appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.    Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  

  Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz responds.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint and does know who victim 1 is.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Victim 1  Initial appearance scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
